name: Hydrogen
summary: Hydrogen is the lightest element and the most abundant chemical substance in the universe.

name: Helium
summary: Helium is a colorless, odorless, tasteless, non-toxic, inert, monatomic gas, the first in the noble gas group.
mnemonic: He refuses to interact with anyone.

name: Lithium
summary: Lithium is a soft, silvery-white alkali metal and the lightest solid element.

name: Beryllium
summary: Beryllium is a divalent element that occurs naturally only in combination with other elements in minerals.

name: Boron
summary: Boron is a metalloid found in small amounts in meteoroids but chemically uncombined boron is not found naturally on Earth.

name: Carbon
summary: Carbon is a chemical element with symbol C and atomic number 6, forming the basis of all known life.

name: Nitrogen
summary: Nitrogen is a common nonmetal element appearing as a colorless odorless diatomic gas.

name: Oxygen
summary: Oxygen is a highly reactive nonmetal and an oxidizing agent that readily forms oxides with most elements.

name: Fluorine
summary: Fluorine is the lightest halogen and exists as a highly toxic pale yellow diatomic gas at standard conditions.

name: Neon
summary: Neon is a colorless, odorless, inert monatomic gas under standard conditions, with about two-thirds the density of air.

name: Sodium
summary: Sodium is a soft, silvery-white, highly reactive metal.

name: Magnesium
summary: Magnesium is a shiny gray solid which bears a close physical resemblance to the other five elements in the second column.

name: Aluminium
summary: Aluminium is a silvery-white, soft, nonmagnetic and ductile metal in the boron group.

name: Silicon
summary: Silicon is a hard, brittle crystalline solid with a blue-grey metallic lustre and is a tetravalent metalloid.

name: Phosphorus
summary: Phosphorus exists in two major forms, white phosphorus and red phosphorus, and is essential for life.

name: Sulfur
summary: Sulfur is an abundant, multivalent and nonmetallic chemical element.

name: Chlorine
summary: Chlorine is a yellow-green gas under standard conditions, where it forms diatomic molecules.

name: Argon
summary: Argon is the third-most abundant gas in the Earth's atmosphere.

name: Potassium
summary: Potassium is a silvery-white metal that is soft enough to be cut with a knife with little force.

name: Calcium
summary: Calcium is a soft gray alkaline earth metal, fifth-most abundant element by mass in the Earth's crust.

name: Scandium
summary: Scandium is a silvery-white metallic d-block element, historically classified as a rare-earth element.

name: Titanium
summary: Titanium is a lustrous transition metal with a silver color, low density, and high strength.

name: Vanadium
summary: Vanadium is a hard, silvery-grey, ductile, and malleable transition metal.

name: Chromium
summary: Chromium is a steely-grey, lustrous, hard and brittle transition metal.

name: Manganese
summary: Manganese is not found as a free element in nature; it is often found in minerals in combination with iron.

name: Iron
summary: Iron is a chemical element with symbol Fe and atomic number 26, the most common element on Earth by mass.

name: Cobalt
summary: Cobalt is found in the Earth's crust only in chemically combined form, save for small deposits found in alloys of meteoric iron.

name: Nickel
summary: Nickel is a silvery-white lustrous metal with a slight golden tinge.

name: Copper
summary: Copper is a soft, malleable, and ductile metal with very high thermal and electrical conductivity.

name: Zinc
summary: Zinc is a slightly brittle metal at room temperature and has a blue-silvery appearance when oxidation is removed.

name: Gallium
summary: Gallium is a soft, silvery metal that melts at near room temperature.

name: Germanium
summary: Germanium is a lustrous, hard-to-brittle, grayish-white metalloid in the carbon group.

name: Arsenic
summary: Arsenic occurs in many minerals, usually in combination with sulfur and metals, but also as a pure elemental crystal.

name: Selenium
summary: Selenium is a nonmetal with properties that are intermediate between the elements above and below in the periodic table.

name: Bromine
summary: Bromine is a fuming red-brown liquid at room temperature that evaporates readily to form a similarly coloured gas.

name: Krypton
summary: Krypton is a colorless, odorless, tasteless noble gas.

name: Rubidium
summary: Rubidium is a soft, silvery-white metallic element of the alkali metal group.

name: Strontium
summary: Strontium is a greyish-white metal found in the minerals celestine and strontianite.

name: Yttrium
summary: Yttrium is a silvery-metallic transition metal chemically similar to the lanthanides.

name: Zirconium
summary: Zirconium is a lustrous, grey-white, strong transition metal that resembles hafnium and, to a lesser extent, titanium.

name: Niobium
summary: Niobium is a light grey, crystalline, and ductile transition metal.

name: Molybdenum
summary: Molybdenum is a chemical element with symbol Mo and atomic number 42.

name: Technetium
summary: Technetium is the lightest chemical element with no stable isotopes.

name: Ruthenium
summary: Ruthenium is a rare transition metal belonging to the platinum group of the periodic table.

name: Rhodium
summary: Rhodium is a rare, silvery-white, hard, chemically inert transition metal.

name: Palladium
summary: Palladium is a rare and lustrous silvery-white metal discovered in 1803.

name: Silver
summary: Silver is a chemical element with symbol Ag and is a soft, white, lustrous transition metal.

name: Cadmium
summary: Cadmium is a soft, silvery-white metal and is chemically similar to the two other stable metals in group 12.

name: Indium
summary: Indium is a post-transition metal that is very soft and malleable.

name: Tin
summary: Tin is a silvery metal that characteristically has a faint yellow hue.

name: Antimony
summary: Antimony is a lustrous gray metalloid, found in nature mainly as the sulfide mineral stibnite.

name: Tellurium
summary: Tellurium is a brittle, mildly toxic, rare, silver-white metalloid.

name: Iodine
summary: Iodine is the heaviest of the stable halogens and exists as a lustrous, purple-black metallic solid.

name: Xenon
summary: Xenon is a colorless, dense, odorless noble gas found in the Earth's atmosphere in trace amounts.

name: Cesium
summary: Cesium is a soft, silvery-golden alkali metal with a melting point of 28.5 Â°C, which makes it one of only five elemental metals that are liquid at or near room temperature.

name: Barium
summary: Barium is a soft, silvery alkaline earth metal and is never found in nature as a free element.

name: Lanthanum
summary: Lanthanum is a soft, ductile, silvery-white metal that tarnishes slowly when exposed to air.

name: Cerium
summary: Cerium is a soft, ductile, and silvery-white metal that tarnishes when exposed to air.

name: Praseodymium
summary: Praseodymium is a soft, silvery, malleable and ductile metal in the lanthanide group.

name: Neodymium
summary: Neodymium is a soft silvery metal that tarnishes in air.

name: Promethium
summary: Promethium is a chemical element with symbol Pm and atomic number 61, all of whose isotopes are radioactive.

name: Samarium
summary: Samarium is a hard silvery metal that slowly oxidizes in air.

name: Europium
summary: Europium is the most reactive lanthanide by far, having to be stored under an inert fluid to protect it from atmospheric oxygen or moisture.

name: Gadolinium
summary: Gadolinium is a silvery-white metal when oxidation is removed.

name: Terbium
summary: Terbium is a silvery-white, rare-earth metal that is malleable, ductile, and soft enough to be cut with a knife.

name: Dysprosium
summary: Dysprosium is a rare-earth element with a metallic silver luster.

name: Holmium
summary: Holmium is a relatively soft and malleable rare-earth element.

name: Erbium
summary: Erbium is a silvery-white solid metal when artificially isolated.

name: Thulium
summary: Thulium is the second-least abundant of the lanthanides.

name: Ytterbium
summary: Ytterbium is a soft, malleable and ductile chemical element that displays a bright silvery luster.

name: Lutetium
summary: Lutetium is a silvery white metal, which resists corrosion in dry air, but not in moist air.

name: Hafnium
summary: Hafnium is a lustrous, silvery gray, tetravalent transition metal.

name: Tantalum
summary: Tantalum is a rare, hard, blue-gray, lustrous transition metal that is highly corrosion-resistant.

name: Tungsten
summary: Tungsten is a rare metal found naturally on Earth almost exclusively as compounds with other elements.

name: Rhenium
summary: Rhenium is a silvery-white, heavy, third-row transition metal.

name: Osmium
summary: Osmium is a hard, brittle, bluish-white transition metal in the platinum group.

name: Iridium
summary: Iridium is a very hard, brittle, silvery-white transition metal of the platinum group.

name: Platinum
summary: Platinum is a dense, malleable, ductile, highly unreactive, precious, silver-white transition metal.

name: Gold
summary: Gold is a bright, slightly reddish yellow, dense, soft, malleable, and ductile metal.

name: Mercury
summary: Mercury is the only metallic element that is liquid at standard conditions for temperature and pressure.

name: Thallium
summary: Thallium is a soft gray post-transition metal that is not found free in nature.

name: Lead
summary: Lead is a heavy metal that is denser than most common materials.

name: Bismuth
summary: Bismuth is the most naturally diamagnetic element, and has one of the lowest thermal conductivity values among metals.

name: Polonium
summary: Polonium is a rare and highly radioactive chemical element.

name: Astatine
summary: Astatine is a radioactive chemical element, the rarest naturally occurring element in the Earth's crust.

name: Radon
summary: Radon is a radioactive, colorless, odorless, tasteless noble gas.

name: Francium
summary: Francium is a highly radioactive metal that decays into astatine, radium, or radon.

name: Radium
summary: Radium is almost pure white, but it reacts readily with nitrogen on exposure to air, forming a black surface layer.

name: Actinium
summary: Actinium is a silvery radioactive metal that reacts rapidly with oxygen and moisture in air forming a white coating.

name: Thorium
summary: Thorium is a weakly radioactive metallic chemical element with symbol Th and atomic number 90.

name: Protactinium
summary: Protactinium is a dense, silvery-gray actinide metal which readily reacts with oxygen, water vapor and inorganic acids.

name: Uranium
summary: Uranium is a silvery-white metal in the actinide series of the periodic table.

name: Neptunium
summary: Neptunium is a hard, silvery, ductile, radioactive actinide metal.

name: Plutonium
summary: Plutonium is a radioactive actinide metal that is an actinide and tarnishes in air.

name: Americium
summary: Americium is a radioactive transuranic chemical element that is a soft radioactive metal.

name: Curium
summary: Curium is a transuranic radioactive chemical element.

name: Berkelium
summary: Berkelium is a transuranic radioactive chemical element.

name: Californium
summary: Californium is a radioactive metal element and an actinide.

name: Einsteinium
summary: Einsteinium is a synthetic element and a soft silvery, radioactive metal.

name: Fermium
summary: Fermium is a synthetic element and an actinide.

name: Mendelevium
summary: Mendelevium is a synthetic element and a radioactive metal.

name: Nobelium
summary: Nobelium is a synthetic chemical element.

name: Lawrencium
summary: Lawrencium is a synthetic chemical element and a radioactive metal.

name: Rutherfordium
summary: Rutherfordium is a synthetic chemical element that is highly radioactive.

name: Dubnium
summary: Dubnium is a synthetic chemical element.

name: Seaborgium
summary: Seaborgium is a synthetic chemical element.

name: Bohrium
summary: Bohrium is a synthetic chemical element.

name: Hassium
summary: Hassium is a synthetic chemical element.

name: Meitnerium
summary: Meitnerium is a synthetic chemical element.

name: Darmstadtium
summary: Darmstadtium is a synthetic chemical element.

name: Roentgenium
summary: Roentgenium is a synthetic chemical element.

name: Copernicium
summary: Copernicium is a synthetic chemical element.

name: Nihonium
summary: Nihonium is a synthetic chemical element.

name: Flerovium
summary: Flerovium is a superheavy synthetic chemical element.

name: Moscovium
summary: Moscovium is a synthetic chemical element.

name: Livermorium
summary: Livermorium is a synthetic chemical element.

name: Tennessine
summary: Tennessine is a synthetic chemical element.

name: Oganesson
summary: Oganesson is a radioactive, synthetic chemical element.
